intro: Dryandra longifolia, commonly known as the narrow-leaf dryandra, is a species of flowering plant in the family Proteaceae. It is native to Western Australia and is characterized by its slender, linear leaves and showy, pink to red flowers. The plant typically grows as a shrub, reaching heights of up to 1.5 meters. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in sandy or rocky habitats. Due to its ornamental value and ecological significance, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens and conservation areas.
